summary: The No Secret Police Act of 2025 mandates that Department of Homeland Security law enforcement officers and agents engaged in border security or immigration enforcement must display or wear visible insignia or uniforms and provide identification when detaining or arresting individuals. The bill also prohibits them from wearing face coverings that conceal their faces. It requires reports on the Department's policies regarding tactical gear and calls for research and development on technology to enhance insignia visibility. Finally, it makes a clerical amendment to the Homeland Security Act of 2002.
